alert.note: Alert for Pike; Ross; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 7:54PM EDT until May 27 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Ohio, including the following counties, Pike, Ross and Scioto. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 753 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported minor flooding in the Pike Lake area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Although the heaviest rain has ended, additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Chillicothe, Waverly, Piketon, Kingston, Bainbridge, Pike Lake, North Folk Village, Kincaid Springs, Londonderry, Laurelville, Adelphi, Rarden, Sinking Spring, Otway, Summithill, Lake White, Buchanan, Knockemstiff, Scioto Trail State Park and Massieville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
